page.title: 12GROUP ACTIVITIES NASH AREA
page.content: Groups meet in the larger village of Nash, mostly in the village hall, though the bell ringers of Beachampton practice on the 5 bells of their local Parish Church of St Mary's. In this community small changes in the population can have a major affect on groups and this year the Over 60's Club closed. Children's clubs are popular, the children coming from here and surrounding villages. The Mother and Toddlers re-started recently and is part of the larger playgroup which meets thrice weekly. The Youth club has a weekly evening session and recently a BMX Club was formed. Nash Women's Institute, part of Swan Group, meets every month. In winter provision is made for riding for the disabled at a local stables.
